## Version 4: With Code Examples

Thank you @lucashertzog for addressing code organization!

**Closing as superseded** - v2.1.0 (Feb 8, 2026) incorporates your improvements.

**Before (your PR):**
```r
# =============================================================================
# unicefData.R
# High-level user-facing interface
# =============================================================================
```

**After (v2.1.0):**
```r
# =============================================================================
# unicefData.R - R interface to UNICEF SDMX Data API
# =============================================================================
# STRUCTURE:
#   1. Imports & Setup
#   2. Utilities
#   3. SDMX Fetchers
#   4. Main API
#   5. Post-Processing
#   6. Reference Data
#   7. Convenience Wrappers
# Version: 2.0.0 (2026-01-31)
# =============================================================================
```

**Your contributions are live!** Plus v2.1.0 adds:
- Enhanced roxygen docs
- Critical bug fix (R package casing)
- Cross-language tests (14 fixtures)
- All CI/CD passing

**Future PRs:** Base on `develop` branch | See CONTRIBUTING.md

v2.1.0: https://github.com/unicef-drp/unicefData/releases/tag/v2.1.0

## Version 5: Professional & Formal

Dear @lucashertzog,

Thank you for submitting PR #28 addressing structural and navigation improvements from Issue #24.

**Disposition:** Closing as superseded

**Rationale:**
The structural enhancements proposed in this PR have been incorporated into version 2.1.0, released February 8, 2026. The current implementation includes your suggested improvements with additional refinements.

**Incorporated Elements:**
- File header documentation with purpose statements
- Section-based code organization
- RStudio navigation compatibility
- Logical function grouping

**Additional Enhancements in v2.1.0:**
- Numbered section structure (1-7)
- Version and authorship metadata
- Enhanced roxygen documentation
- Critical bug corrections
- Comprehensive test coverage (44 Python tests, enhanced R/Stata)

**Recommendation for Future Contributions:**
We welcome continued collaboration. Please note our development workflow:
- Target branch: `develop` (not `main`)
- Review current code structure before beginning work
- Consult CONTRIBUTING.md for process guidelines
- Ensure test passage prior to submission

**References:**
- Release v2.1.0: https://github.com/unicef-drp/unicefData/releases/tag/v2.1.0
- Development branch: https://github.com/unicef-drp/unicefData/tree/develop

Your attention to code organization and maintainability is appreciated and has positively influenced the project.
